ref: 6798 dhārmiká ʻ righteous ʼ Mn., m. ʻ judge ʼ lex., ʻ juggler ʼ Ratnāv. [dharmin -- ]
Ku. dhāmī m. ʻ drummer who excites people to dance under the inspiration of a deity ʼ;
N. dhāmi ʻ wizard ʼ, dhamini ʻ his wife ʼ;
H. dhāmiyã̄ m. pl. ʻ a Hindu sect who are followers of Prānnāth ʼ;
M. dhāmyā, ˚mā, dhām -- gãḍ m. ʻ insulting term of address to a Mādhyandina or Yajurvedī ʼ (LM 354 < dharmya -- ).
